info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 6 at 2:49AM EDT until July 6 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry.
* WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Socastee, Little River, Garden City, Cherry Grove Inlet, Little River Entrance, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach, Forestbrook, Wampee, Cherry Grove Beach, Briarcliffe Acres, Atlantic Beach, Grand Strand Regional Medical Center and Sea Coast Medical Center. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
